intro: Critesion santacrucense, commonly known as the Santa Cruz cactus, is a unique member of the Cactaceae family native to the coastal regions of Santa Cruz, Argentina. It is characterized by its low-growing, cushion-like structure with short, spiny stems that help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the spring, which are pollinated by insects and birds. Its thick, fleshy stems store water, enabling it to survive in dry conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat vulnerability, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
